protein.specific_function: Aminopeptidases catalyze the hydrolysis of amino acid residues from the N-terminus of peptide or protein substrates. Able to cleave angiotensin III to generate angiotensin IV, a bioactive peptide of the renin-angiotensin pathway. Not able to cleave angiotensin I and angiotensin II. May play a role in the proteolytic processing of bioactive peptides in tissues such as testis and heart

go_class.description: peptidase activity, acting on l-amino acid peptides

reference.reference_text: Diaz-Perales A, Quesada V, Sanchez LM, Ugalde AP, Suarez MF, Fueyo A, Lopez-Otin C: Identification of human aminopeptidase O, a novel metalloprotease with structural similarity to aminopeptidase B and leukotriene A4 hydrolase. J Biol Chem. 2005 Apr 8;280(14):14310-7. Epub 2005 Feb 1.
